oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Progressive Missionary Baptist Church, 2001 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Progressive Missionary Baptist Church located at 1419 Twelfth Avenue South. The congregation was founded in 1936 while the building construction was finished in 1941. The church has been listed as Progressive Missionary Baptist and Progressive Baptist depending on the year. The foundation is made of stone. The exterior walls are brick. The roof is composed of tar shingles. The windows are stained glass. A large oculus window adorns the front. The doors are metal with glass plates. Special features include two long, rectangular stained glass windows with floral patterns on either side of the arched entryway. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Progressive Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Progressive Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
